===============================================
GITHUB SECRETS SETUP FOR RELEASE SIGNING
===============================================

To enable proper release signing in GitHub Actions, you need to add the following secrets to your repository:

----------------------------------------------
STEP 1: Go to GitHub Repository Settings
----------------------------------------------
1. Navigate to: https://github.com/rxxeron/EWUmate
2. Click on "Settings" tab
3. Click on "Secrets and variables" → "Actions"
4. Click "New repository secret" button

----------------------------------------------
STEP 2: Add These 4 Secrets
----------------------------------------------

Secret Name: KEYSTORE_BASE64
Value:


---

Secret Name: KEY_ALIAS
Value: upload

---

Secret Name: KEY_PASSWORD
Value: android123

---

Secret Name: STORE_PASSWORD
Value: android123

----------------------------------------------
STEP 3: Verify Setup
----------------------------------------------
After adding all 4 secrets:
1. Go to "Actions" tab in your repository
2. Click on "Android Build" workflow
3. Click "Run workflow" button
4. The APK will be built with proper release signing

----------------------------------------------
IMPORTANT NOTES
----------------------------------------------
✅ Changes made to the project:
   - targetSdk and compileSdk lowered from 36 to 34 for Android 10 compatibility
   - Proper release signing configuration added
   - GitHub Actions workflow updated to use keystore secrets

✅ The keystore files are protected:
   - upload-keystore.jks is in .gitignore
   - key.properties is in .gitignore
   - Only base64-encoded keystore is in GitHub Secrets

⚠️  Security:
   - Keep these passwords secure
   - Never share the keystore file publicly
   - Change passwords if you suspect they're compromised

----------------------------------------------
WHAT THIS FIXES
----------------------------------------------
✓ APK will now install on Android 10 devices
✓ Proper release signing instead of debug keys
✓ Compatible with Google Play Store requirements
✓ Secure keystore management via GitHub Secrets
